thread.title: Clinton's voice was slowed down by meds, says Drudge
thread.title_full: Clinton's voice was slowed down by meds, says Drudge | Washington Examiner

author: Eddie Scarry
title: Clinton's voice was slowed down by meds, says Drudge
text:
Matt Drudge, founder and editor of the influential Drudge Report, believes Hillary Clinton was hopped up on anti-anxiety medication during her testimony Thursday in front of the Republican-led House Benghazi Select Committee.
On Twitter, Drudge said it was clear.
Last time she showed up with prism glasses from blod clot, vertigo. Today obvious anti-anxiety meds, hypothyroid issues. #BenghaziCommittee — MATT DRUDGE (@DRUDGE) October 23, 2015 
Hillary health was biggest revelation at hearing. Coughing fit. Slow-speaking, obviously induced by meds. Choose not to believe if you must— MATT DRUDGE (@DRUDGE) October 23, 2015 
  Obama says GOP field like Grumpy Cat He compared GOP climate change denials to a sick patient who refuses to listen to his doctors.
By Nicole Duran • 10/23/15 5:43 PM "Hillary health was biggest revelation at hearing," Drudge wrote Thursday night after the hearing was over. "Coughing fit. Slow-speaking, obviously induced by meds. Choose not to believe if you must."
In a follow-up tweet, Drudge said, "Today obvious anti-anxiety meds, hypothyroid issues."
Clinton's doctor Lisa Bardack said publicly over the summer that the Democratic presidnetial frontrunner was in "excellent physical health," but did admit that she was taking blood thinning medication for her thyroid.
Drudge, along with some other conservatives, have suggested in the past that Clinton is hiding serious health issues. In his latest book, Unlikeable: The Problem With Hillary , controversial author Ed Klein wrote that Clinton is facing "mounting health issues."
Representatives for the Clinton campaign did not respond to a request for comment.
Also from the Washington Examiner Press yawns, declares Hillary Clinton 'won' the Benghazi hearing Both left and right-leaning media appear to share the sentiment that Clinton "won" the Benghazi hearing.
By Becket Adams • 10/23/15 5:31 PM Top Story Justice won't charge IRS' Lois Lerner The   matter.
By Curt Mills • 10/23/15 3:04 PM
